decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: 10390 001 (Site Location Plan), 10390 002 (Existing and Proposed GF Plans), 10390 003 (Existing and Proposed Basement Plans), 10390 004 (Front and Rear Elevations), 10390 005 (Side Elevations) and Design & Access Statement Prepared by Elias Haddad (ref: EH/10390-BL07).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The use of the premises shall not be permitted outside of the hours of 07:00 to 22:00 Mondays to Saturdays and 08:00 to 20:00 on Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to the first use of the development, all external doors to the kitchen shall be fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to rooms where noise, smell, smoke or fumes may be emitted, be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise /odour /smoke /fumes, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6, D14 and SI 1of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | No removal of refuse nor bottles/cans to external bins or areas at the development shall be carried out other than between the hours of 08:00 to 20:00 on Monday to Saturday and 10:00 to 20:00 on Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The use of the premises shall not include the playing of music without the Council's approval of details that demonstrate appropriate mitigation measures, in accordance with the Council's standard and noise limits specified by BS8233:2014 at affected neighbouring premises.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or vibration, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to the first use of the development, details of the installation, operation, and maintenance of an odour abatement equipment and extract system shall be submitted to the Council and approved in writing. The details shall include the height of the extract duct and vertical discharge outlet with the cowl at least 1m above the eaves of the main building, and a reasonable distance of the extract outlet approximately 20.0meters from any openable window unless effective odour control is installed. Approved details shall be implemented prior to the first use of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell or steam, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy SI 1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to the first use of the development, details of enhanced sound insulation of at least 10dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use, as necessary, of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the commercial use from dwellings shall be submitted to the Council and approved in writing. Where noise emissions include characteristic features, the Noise Rating level shall not exceed NR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside a bedroom and NR30 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside a living room. Details of mitigation measures shall include the installation method, materials of separating structures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound/rating level. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to the first use of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with standard 30 of the Housing SPG, policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to first use of the development, details of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate shall be submitted to the Council and approved in writing. The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies  1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
subdivision_of_building: The proposal only affects the building's ground floor and basement level.
description: Change of use from retail (Use Class E(a)) to restaurant/caf√© (Use Class (E(b))

phasing_details.phase_detail: Internal works to change the use of the unit.
